outputs.output_descr: This Khimti Neighbourhood Development (KIND) project is a public-private partnership between Government of Nepal (GON).  United Nations Development Programme and Himal Power.  Key intended outputs are i) electrification of 3,100 households in Khimti Hydro Power plant neighbourhood; ii) provision of community infrastructures and promotion of micro-enterprises; iii) strengthening of Khimti Rural Electric Cooperative KREC) to make it fully capable of taking forward the rural electrification in a sustainable way in the future.  The rural electrification will be accomplished through construction of a 400kW mini-hydro power plant, establishment of rural electrification and distribution lines t connect the households.  Community will be mobilized and gender and social development plans will be prepared. Smaller community infrastructures will be constructed or improved as well as micro-enterprises will be promoted.  Training will be provided to KREC members and support will be provided for KREC's institutional development.  Alternative Energy Promotion Centre (AEPC) of GoN will implement the project.  REDP, DLGSP and MEEP will be the key players in providing expertise in the area of rural electrification, enterprise development and social empowerment.  The total funding for the project will be equivalent to approximately US$ 3,859,319 of which US$ 200,000 will be funded by UNDP and NOK 22,248,662 will come from HPL. Of the total amount from HPL, NOK 19,574,000 will be provided by the Norwegian Government.  The project period will be 3 years beginning from 2007 to 2010.

Of the total amount from HPL, NOK 19,574,000 will be provided by the Norwegian Government.  The project period will be 3 years beginning from 2007 to 2010.

project_descr: Expanding access to environmental and energy services for the poor
